sen.e: Mitsuko SONO (Mibuin), who was the consort of Emperor Gomizunoo and the real mother of Emperor Gokomyo, as well as the wife of Shigemitsu YANAGIHARA, Dainagon, and the wife of Takatsugu KYOGOKU, the lord of Obama domain, were his daughters.

sen.j: 長女園光子は後水尾天皇の後宮に入っており、光子の産んだ皇子は後光明天皇として即位する。
sen.e: His first daughter Mitsuko SONO had been received at the court as the consort to Emperor Gomizunoo, and her son ascended the throne as Emperor Gokomyo later.

sen.j: そのため、基任は後光明天皇の外戚にあたり、後光明天皇が即位した後の正保2年（1645年）には左大臣を追贈されている。
sen.e: Thus the deceased Mototo became the maternal relative of Emperor Gokomyo after the emperor ascended the throne, so Mototo was conferred the rank of Sadaijin in 1645.
Therefore, Mototo became the maternal relative of Emperor Gokomyo, and in 1645, after the enthronment, Mototo was posthumously conferred Sadaijin.

sen.j: その後、後光明天皇は若くして崩御するが、この時の縁で基任の子基音の娘である園国子（新広義門院）も後水尾天皇の後宮として召された。
sen.e: Emperor Gokomyo subsequently demised at young, but Mototo's granddaughter Kuniko SONO (Shin-kogimonin) (Motonari's daughter) was also made the consort of Emperor Gomizunoo.

sen.e: Emperor Gokomyo passed away in his youth, but by ties of kinship, Mototo's granddaughter Kuniko SONO (Shin-kogimonin) (a daughter of Motonari, Mototo's son) was also received as the consort of Emperor Gomizunoo.
